newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albania awards Milan Kundera top literary prize.
newsitem.headline: Albania awards Milan Kundera top literary prize.

text.p: An Albanian cultural foundation on Wednesday awarded Czech writer Milan Kundera the nation's top literary prize, worth $20,000.

"I was very touched to read your letter and to learn that your jury has awarded me the literary prize "Ismail Kadare,'" Kundera wrote to the foundation's director. "It is with great pleasure that I accept this honour."
Best known for his novels "The Joke" (1967), "The Book of Laughter and Forgetting" (1979) and "The Unbearable Lightness of Being (1982), Kundera is the second foreign writer to be awarded the prize.
Argentinian novelist Ernesto Sabato was last year's winner of the Ismail Kadare award, which is named after an Albanian writer.
